intro: Kohautia subverticillata subsp. subverticillata, commonly known as the New Zealand tree fern, is a species native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its fronds are bioluminescent, a unique trait that aids in attracting nocturnal pollinators. This species plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, contributing to biodiversity and forest structure.
